FacilityName: City of Fernandina Beach Water Plant #2

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The City of Fernandina Beach, Water Treatment Plant #3 (Facility) complies with EPA's accident prevention rule, OSHA's PSM rule, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The stationary and regulated substance is Chlorine gas. The chlorinator system is a vacuum system and is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with the Chlorine Institute standards and the Florida Department of Environmental Protection state regulations.



The Facility is proactive regarding safety at its facility. The Facility has safety programs in place to prevent accidents, as well as respond to accidents, should they occur. The Facility's prevention programs include the following:



Risk Management Plan

Process Safety Management Plan

Hazard Communication

Lock Out/Tag Out

Fall Protection



To prepare for an emergency at the Facility, the operators have been trained in the following:



Respiratory Protection

Emergency Action and Fire Prevention



The operators at the Facility are Florida State Certified professionals. The operators have years of experience safely handling chlorine an as of 8/26/13 have NEVER had an accident involving chlorine that caused deaths, injuries, property, or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the chlorinator system or the stored chlorine, it is Facility policy to notify 911 (Fernandina Beach Dispatcher) and request response to the emergency. Additional emergency response can be obtained through the Nassau County Hazmat Team, if necessary. Evacuate to a safe distance and notify supervision. Then notify Chlorine Supplier Jones Chemical at 904-355-0779 and Chemtrec at 800-424-9300. We have discussed this policy with the City of Fernandina Beach Police and Fire Departments. Fire department personnel have inspected our chlorine system and perform routine safety inspections of the Facility.
